page.title: 11TYPICAL FARM (2).
page.content: Hayes Farm extends to 208 acres and is situated on the Fladbury road, one mile from Bishampton. The soil type is kuyper marl which is heavy and is also prone to drought. The fields vary in size from 6 to 30 acres. The Tarver family have been at the farm since 1964. There are now three dwellings on the farm occupied by members of the family. The main farm buildings are a dairy unit housing 200 cattle, milking parlour, effluent storage and silage clamps to store winter feed. The whole farm is down to grass except for 30 acres of plums. Grass is used for grazing and silage to provide feed for the livestock, a herd of 130 British Friesian dairy cows producing 800,000 litres of milk a year, dairy youngstock and a flock of 100 Suffolk sheep from which breeding rams are sold.
